meanings.definition: The process of growing inward or into something.
meanings.sent1: The ingrowth of roots into the soil helps the plant absorb nutrients.
meanings.sent2: The ingrowth of vines on the wall created a beautiful green pattern.
meanings.sent3: The ingrowth of spaghetti into a tangled mess in the pot made it hard to serve.
meanings.sent4: The ingrowth of ideas in her mind blossomed into a brilliant solution.
meanings.sent5: The ingrowth of ivy on the old building made it look like a fairytale castle.

meanings.definition: Something that grows inward or into something else.
meanings.sent1: She noticed an ingrowth of mold in the corner of the room.
meanings.sent2: The ingrowth of tree roots cracked the pavement over time.
meanings.sent3: The ingrowth of weeds in the garden surprised the gardener.
meanings.sent4: The ingrowth of curiosity in the child's mind led to many questions.
meanings.sent5: The ingrowth of ivy on the fence created a natural barrier.
